service: The FinSpace management service provides the APIs for managing the FinSpace environments.

operations.ListEnvironments: A list of all of your FinSpace environments.
operations.ListTagsForResource: A list of all tags for a resource.
operations.TagResource: Adds metadata tags to a FinSpace resource.
operations.UntagResource: Removes metadata tags from a FinSpace resource.

AccessDeniedException.base: You do not have sufficient access to perform this action.

refs.FederationParameters$attributeMap: SAML attribute name and value. The name must always be Email and the value should be set to the attribute definition in which user email is set. For example, name would be Email and value http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2005/05/identity/claims/emailaddress. Please check your SAML 2.0 compliant identity provider (IdP) documentation for details.

refs.CreateEnvironmentRequest$description: The description of the FinSpace environment to be created.

refs.CreateEnvironmentResponse$environmentArn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the FinSpace environment that you created.
refs.Environment$environmentArn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of your FinSpace environment.
refs.ListTagsForResourceRequest$resourceArn: The Amazon Resource Name of the resource.
refs.TagResourceRequest$resourceArn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the resource.
refs.UntagResourceRequest$resourceArn: A FinSpace resource from which you want to remove a tag or tags. The value for this parameter is an Amazon Resource Name (ARN).

refs.ListEnvironmentsResponse$environments: A list of all of your FinSpace environments.

refs.CreateEnvironmentRequest$name: The name of the FinSpace environment to be created.

refs.Environment$status: The current status of creation of the FinSpace environment.

refs.CreateEnvironmentRequest$federationMode:
Authentication mode for the environment.

  • FEDERATED - Users access FinSpace through Single Sign On (SSO) via your Identity provider.

  • LOCAL - Users access FinSpace via email and password managed within the FinSpace environment.
refs.UpdateEnvironmentRequest$federationMode:
Authentication mode for the environment.

  • FEDERATED - Users access FinSpace through Single Sign On (SSO) via your Identity provider.

  • LOCAL - Users access FinSpace via email and password managed within the FinSpace environment.

FederationParameters.base: Configuration information when authentication mode is FEDERATED.

refs.CreateEnvironmentRequest$federationParam: Configuration information when authentication mode is FEDERATED.
refs.Environment$federationParameters: Configuration information when authentication mode is FEDERATED.

refs.CreateEnvironmentResponse$environmentId: The unique identifier for FinSpace environment that you created.
refs.Environment$awsAccountId: The ID of the AWS account in which the FinSpace environment is created.
refs.Environment$dedicatedServiceAccountId: The AWS account ID of the dedicated service account associated with your FinSpace environment.

InternalServerException.base: The request processing has failed because of an unknown error, exception or failure.

InvalidRequestException.base: The request is invalid. Something is wrong with the input to the request.

refs.CreateEnvironmentRequest$kmsKeyId: The KMS key id to encrypt your data in the FinSpace environment.
refs.Environment$kmsKeyId: The KMS key id used to encrypt in the FinSpace environment.

LimitExceededException.base: A service limit or quota is exceeded.

refs.ListEnvironmentsRequest$nextToken: A token generated by FinSpace that specifies where to continue pagination if a previous request was truncated. To get the next set of pages, pass in the nextToken value from the response object of the previous page call.
refs.ListEnvironmentsResponse$nextToken: A token that you can use in a subsequent call to retrieve the next set of results.

ResourceNotFoundException.base: One or more resources can't be found.

refs.ListEnvironmentsRequest$maxResults: The maximum number of results to return in this request.

ServiceQuotaExceededException.base: You have exceeded your service quota. To perform the requested action, remove some of the relevant resources, or use Service Quotas to request a service quota increase.

refs.Environment$sageMakerStudioDomainUrl: The url of the integrated FinSpace notebook environment in your web application.

refs.UntagResourceRequest$tagKeys: The tag keys (names) of one or more tags to be removed.

refs.ListTagsForResourceResponse$tags: A list of all tags for a resource.
refs.TagResourceRequest$tags: One or more tags to be assigned to the resource.

ThrottlingException.base: The request was denied due to request throttling.

ValidationException.base: The input fails to satisfy the constraints specified by an AWS service.

refs.CreateEnvironmentResponse$environmentUrl: The sign-in url for the web application of the FinSpace environment you created.
refs.Environment$environmentUrl: The sign-in url for the web application of your FinSpace environment.
refs.FederationParameters$samlMetadataURL: Provide the metadata URL from your SAML 2.0 compliant identity provider (IdP).
refs.FederationParameters$applicationCallBack: The redirect or sign-in URL that should be entered into the SAML 2.0 compliant identity provider configuration (IdP).

refs.FederationParameters$federationURN: The Uniform Resource Name (URN). Also referred as Service Provider URN or Audience URI or Service Provider Entity ID.
